glsa.title: MUNGE: Privilege escalation
glsa.synopsis: Gentoo's MUNGE ebuilds are vulnerable to privilege escalation due to improper permissions.

background.p: An authentication service for creating and validating credentials.

description.p: It was discovered that Gentoo’s default MUNGE installation suffered from a privilege escalation vulnerability (munge user to root) due to improper permissions and a runscript which called chown() on a user controlled file.

impact.p: A local attacker, who either is already MUNGE’s system user or belongs to MUNGE’s group, could potentially escalate privileges.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All MUNGE users should upgrade to the latest version:
